Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 1. **Analyze the Request:** * **Input:** A textual pseudo-BPMN representation of a multinational smartphone supply chain process (from market research to sales cycle adjustment). * **Task:** Generate 20 open-ended, thought-provoking questions. * **Focus Areas:** Rationale behind process flows, potential improvements, risk management, decision-making, stakeholder communication, and performance measurement. * **Constraint:** Do not provide any SQL queries. Just list the questions.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 2. **Analyze the Process Flow:** * Start -> Market Research -> R&D Design. * Parallel Split: Sourcing components from multiple countries (Taiwan, Japan, South Korea, Germany/USA). * Parallel Join -> Ship to Malaysia -> Assemble (24/7). * Exclusive Gateway: Quality Check (Pass -> Continue, Fail -> Rework/Scrap). * Pack & Label. * Parallel Split: Logistics (Air Freight vs. Cargo Ship). * Parallel Join -> Customs/Compliance -> Regional Distribution Centers. * Parallel Split: Last Mile (Warehousing, Retailers, E-Commerce, VIP). * Parallel Join -> Monitor Inventory/Sales. * Exclusive Gateway: Adjust Orders vs. Proceed. * End.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3. **Brainstorming Categories:** * *Rationale/Strategy:* Why this structure? Why these locations? * *Risk Management:* Supply chain disruptions, quality failures, logistics delays. * *Decision-Making:* Gateways (quality, inventory adjustments), sourcing choices. * *Stakeholder Communication:* Suppliers, assembly plant, logistics partners, retailers. * *Performance Measurement:* KPIs, efficiency, sustainability. * *Improvements/Innovation:* Automation, sustainability, resilience.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
